description._content: Johnston, Frances Benjamin,, 1864-1952,, photographer. [Belmont, Falmouth, Stafford County, Virginia. Sculpture on south lawn] [between 1927 and 1929] 1 photograph : glass lantern slide hand-colored ; 3.25 x 4 in. Notes: Site History. House Architecture: Gari Melchers house, 224 Washington St., Falmouth. Late 18th century house with additions by Gari Melchers, who purchased the property in 1916. Landscape: Gari and Corinne Mackall (Mrs. Gari) Melchers. Today: House a Virginia and National Historic Landmark administered by Mary Washington University. Paper mask is a line grid. Slide for lecturing on "Tales Old Houses Tell." Title and date based on same image in the Carnegie Survey of the Architecture of the South, LC-J7-VA-B2787, with additional information from Sam Watters, 2011. Forms part of: Garden and historic house lecture series in the Frances Benjamin Johnston Collection (Library of Congress). Rights Info: No known restrictions on publication. Repository: Library of Congress, Prints and Photographs Division, Washington, D.C. 20540 USA, hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/pp.print Higher resolution image is available (Persistent URL): hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/ppmsca.16639 Call Number: LC-J717-X106- 69
